JobListing.ShortDescription: Digger Operator required for immediate start!

Bulletpoints.BulletPoint1: North Shore Location- No more city traffic!
Bulletpoints.BulletPoint3: Grow your career in Civil Construction

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Excavator/Digger Operator

• Great Pay Rates!
• Great company
• Good gear

Stellar Recruitment is your number one choice for finding the best job opportunities in the civil construction market. We are specialists in civil infrastructure, construction and mining, and recruit for opportunities in NZ, Australia and even further abroad.

We are seeking a skilled, reliable Operator, who has experience operating excavators.

This role is not for the faint hearted, it is a physically demanding role that will give you the opportunity to further develop your career in the Civil construction industry. Not only will you be operating multiple machines but you will also be assisting on the ground as and when required.

Typically building Retaining Walls on large scale Civil works projects, our ideal candidate will have experience in the following:

• Drilling with Pendulum type drill rigs
• Excavating of footings
• Bulk Backfilling
• Compaction knowledge
• Machine Maintenance abilities

In order to be considered for this role you must have:

• Current Class 2 driver’s license
• Wheels Tracks and Rollers endorsed
• Excellent verbal communication skills
• Carry out regular maintenance of plant
• Team Player
• Reliable & punctual

What’s in it for you:

• Competitive rates of pay
• Optional Vehicle, phone & fuel neg
• Training opportunities

If this sounds like you, apply online today!!

For more information on the role including duties, hours and rates of pay, contact Fern on 09 969 1028 or email your CV to fern.d@stellarrecruitment.co.nz

Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Grader Operator- great opportunity to join a awesome team!
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Grader operator


The Company

Our Auckland based company has a huge workload on over the foreseeable future and they are looking for a final trim grader operator to join their outstanding team on a permanent basis.

What we’re looking for:

  • Ideally a minimum of 10 years in the industry on a grader.
  • Strong attention to detail with a focus on quality workmanship
  • Good problem solving skills
  • Able to work with minimal supervision and as part of a crew
  • Willing to learn and have a strong work ethic
  • Be physically fit
  • Be a genuine team player

We seek applicants with a positive attitude towards maintaining a safe working environment and motivated to helping our client achieve Zero Harm.

Supervisory Level:

• 10 years final trim Grader experience
• Proven ability to lead a crew and run jobs
• GPS experience a bonus but not essential
• Ability to operate other various machinery Eg: Digger, Bully (again not essential)

If this sounds like you and you would like to apply for this role or for more information please contact Fern at Stellar Workforce on 09 969 1028 or email your CV to fern.d@stellarworkforce.co.nz

JobListing.ShortDescription: Experienced Digger Operators needed for immediate start!
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Stellar Recruitment is your number one choice for finding the best job opportunities in the civil construction market in 2016.

Our clients want us to find the best excavator operators we can! With drainage projects increasing, we want to hear from skilled excavator operators with drainage experience. 

If you can say yes to the following then we want to hear from you.

  • Class 1, WTR, with Class 2 advantageous
  • Pipe installation and/or pipe renewal projects
  • Deep drainage experience up to 6m
  • Digging inside trench shields with and without spotter assistance
  • Digging around services in and above the ground
  • Able to dig to height and levels
  • Final trim experience advantageous
  • Trenching and backfilling
  • Experience on machines up to 20 tonne
  • Ability to assist with ground works


If your skills and experience are described in the above, then Stellar want to hear from you.

You will also have:

  • The right to work in New Zealand
  • A good level of physical fitness
  • Demonstrate sound Health and Safety practices

 

For further information about this role or to discuss other positions on offer, please contact Fern Dickinson on 09 969 1028 or email fern.d@stellarworkforce.co.nz

Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Senior Structural Engineer with or working towards **CPENG with a minimum of 6+ years’ experience and have strong proficiency with ETABS, SpaceGASS
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Senior Structural Design Engineers, are you on track with your 5 year plan?
The dreaded 5 year plan, your ideological path to success over the next 5 years but is your current company going to help you achieve this? Whether it’s career path, team culture, progression and of course money, all of these factor in to your success, and your enjoyment of the role, but do you have what you want?

Stellar has partnered with an emerging consultancy who have one goal in mind…***GROWTH. With strong fundamentals and family ideals within the company who value and implement your input, this is a real opportunity for a Senior Structural Engineer with or working towards **CPENG with a minimum of 6+ years’ experience and have strong proficiency with ETABS, SpaceGASS.

Your responsibilities will be to manage structural design of projects varying in size from medium to large, have strong ability and confidence liaising with varying professionals from: Clients, Contractors to Architects, as well as advising during design and construction stage on various projects.

What this company will offer you:
• Clear supported career progression
• Exciting projects
• Sense of value and appreciation
• No corporate politics

What we require from you:

• CPENG or working towards your Chartership
• New Zealand Experiance
• 6+ years Structural Design Experience
• Client facing skills
• Strong proficiency with ETABS and SpaceGass.
• Desire to grow your career

So if your plan needs help, maybe you feel undervalued, tired of the corporate world, or just fancy a change I am here to help. If your skills match above please apply directly with your CV to adam.t@stellarrecruitment.co.nz I must implore that before you apply you must have all documentation to work in New Zealand, and that New Zealand experience is preferred. Take that 1st step today and get in touch, and let’s discuss your next move.


Thank you for your time.

Adam Towler
Engineering & Design Specialist
P +64 9 969 1029
SK917023A

JobListing.ShortDescription: leader to oversee the Engineering Division preferably with a combined Civil/Structural background, but is open to candidates with specialty in either
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Principal Engineer/Engineering Manager, where is your next challenge coming from?

Stellar has partnered with an emerging consultancy who have one goal in mind…***GROWTH. With strong fundamentals and family ideals within the company who believe it is time to really spread their wings and have a leader at forefront driving success.

With growth plans in the pipeline and projects won my client is looking for the ideal ***leader, to oversee the Engineering Division preferably with a combined Civil/Structural background, but is open to candidates with specialty in either.

What this company will offer you:
• Clear supported career progression
• Family run business, no corporate politics
• Exciting projects
• Guided support
• Autonomous working environment

What we require from you:
• CPENG
• New Zealand Experience
• 9+ years’ experience covering both/ either Civil and Structural
• Leadership skills
• Team management

So if a new challenge is what you need, a chance to work Autonomously, fresh faces around you, and join a growing company, please look no further. If you match the above skills please reply directly with your CV to adam.t@stellarrecruitment.co.nz I must implore that before you apply you must have all documentation to work in New Zealand, and that New Zealand experience is preferred. Make that change today, the growth plan starts with you.

*** Referral Bonus subject to terms.

Thank you for your time.

Adam Towler
Engineering & Design Specialist
P +64 9 969 1029

JobListing.ShortDescription: Seeking experienced excavator operators for an even time roster, minimum 6 month contract. Coal mine located near Blackwater.
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• BIBO Even time 5/5 roster
  • Immediate Start
  • Mine located near Blackwater
  • Camps and meals provided

The team at Stellar Workforce would like to hear from experienced coal mining  Excavator Operators who hold RII’s for the following machinery:

  • Liebherr 994 and 996

To be considered for this role you must display a strong and stable work background with 3+ years recent mining experience, in addition to a safety first attitude. Ideal applicants will be available to commence immediately.

Successful applicants must be able to supply:

  • Current CBM – Section 4
  • Standard 11
  • Current Drivers Licence
  • Supporting RIIs

Please note these are not trainee positions and candidates will only be contacted if they meet the above criteria.

To apply for these positions please click on the APPLY link below.

Alternatively, for a confidential discussion please email your resume quoting reference number GM28224

Consultant: Georgia Mackie
Email: Georgia.m@stellarworkforce.com.au

JobListing.ShortDescription: TIER 1 Builder / Terrific Major Building Development / Coordinate Services Installation Subbies / Job Security / CIRCA $130-140K + Super / Start ASAP!
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Tier 1 Commercial Builder, High Performance Team
  • Major Perth Metro Commercial Project, START ASAP!
  • Superb Salary Package (CIRCA $140K + super)

Our client is a Tier 1 commercial building company in Perth that has a current requirement for a Services Supervisor to join their highly professional site construction team. This role will specifically involve coordination and management of services subcontractors on site during construction of a large multi-level commercial building development.

This is a superb position that will provide long term job security on a major project. This building project is valued in excess of $100m and therefore we are seeking an experienced Services Supervisor who has recently coordinated all building services installations on similar commercial building projects in Perth for prominent Tier 1 or 2 builders.

As Services Supervisor you will be responsible for interpreting services design drawings and specifications, then coordinating and monitoring services subcontractors during installation of; Hydraulics, Electrical, Mechanical, Fire, ICT, Lifts, Acoustic, Lagging and Anti-vibration. It is essential that you are technically savvy on services installation and highly adept in programming these works on large scale commercial construction developments in order to drive the performance of subcontractors and meet key deadlines and deliverables. Your experience may have been gained on projects such as major hospitals, high rise buildings such as commercial office towers, hotels or similar building projects.

To be considered for this role you will ideally have the following qualifications, skills and experience:

  • 5+ years stable experience as a Services Supervisor in the commercial building sector with Tier 1&2 building companies in Perth
  • Recent experience on commercial building developments ($100m+) in Western Australia as a Services Supervisor
  • Recent experience coordinating and supervising subcontractors on installation of services on high rise projects including; Hydraulics, Electrical, Mechanical, Fire, ICT, Lifts installation, Acoustic, Lagging and Anti-vibration
  • Excellent ability to read and interpret services designs and specifications in conjunction with Arch documentation
  • Strong construction programming skills and ability to look ahead to plan for upcoming workload
  • Great communication skills with ability to contribute confidently during site meetings
  • Ability to coordinate and drive services trades to push program and achieve deliverables
  • Currently based in Perth with existing rights to live and work in Australia

As the successful Services Supervisor you will be offered a superb Perth based salary CIRCA $130-140K (+ super) which will be reflective of your skills and previous relevant experience.

To apply for this position please click on the APPLY link below. Alternatively, for a confidential appraisal of the current market please contact or email your resume quoting reference number SA28302.

Consultant: Scott Alexander

Phone: 08 9422 2702

Email: scott@stellarrecruitment.com.au

JobListing.ShortDescription: Christchurch / $90k - $100k / Full Private Use Vehicle / Award Winning Contractor / Career Progression into Management Positions /

Bulletpoints.BulletPoint3: Well Established & Reputable Christchurch Civil Contractor

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• $90k - $100k + Full Private Use Company Vehicle + Phone
• Leading Drainage & Civil Contractor
• Career Progression Into Management Positions

This company is an award winning civil contractor in Christchurch who specialise in drainage, sheet piling, de-watering, pump stations, pipe bursting, retaining walls, subdivision construction and large manhole installation projects.

Having recently won several high profile projects on top of their existing portfolio of work, they now require a hands on Drainage Foreman who can drive production on site and deliver projects successfully. In this role reporting to the General Manager, you will oversee a drainage crew of 4 - 5 staff and have full autonomy of the drainage team's day to day performance on site.

Some of your day to day tasks may include:

• Set-out of site, and co-ordination of crew
• Being hands on when required, lay pipe and operate machinery
• Revision of designs / plans, liaise with engineers and project managers
• Management of health and safety, on-site training, and quality control
• Key decision-making and on-the-fly coordination
• Communication with the Project Manager to ensure smooth day-to-day running of the operation

Ideally for this role you will have:

• Proven experience in horizontal civil construction
• Relevant drainage tickets (Registered / Certified Drainlayer)
• Exposure to a wide range of commercial drainage and broader civil projects

In return, you will be working for a reputable, long-standing contracting firm that is well established within the Canterbury region, with an attractive forward workload. Their emphasis upon developing their staff, means that they are looking for someone who is ready to commit to their organisation and further develop their skills.

This role would be an ideal stepping stone for someone who is looking to take the next step in their career into a Site Supervisor or Project Management level position.

To apply for this position please click on the 'Apply to this job' link below.

Alternatively, for a confidential appraisal of the current market, please contact Jordan Buchanan or email your CV quoting reference number JB19803.

Consultant: Jordan Buchanan
Phone: 03 353 5683 or 021 224 2814
Email: jordan@stellarrecruitment.co.nz  

SK91353A

JobListing.ShortDescription: Exceptional career development opportunities, set your targets on management and be rewarded on the way.
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Reputable international engineering consultancy
  • An exceptional design team backed by a commendable reputation
  • Strong portfolio of projects in multiple industries
  • Desirable Sydney location

Stellar Recruitment is seeking a talented Civil Designer for a dynamic Engineering Consultancy who continue to develop primarily in the Land Development and Urban Development sectors.

To be successful in this role, you must have the following attributes:

  • Strong experience in the Land and Urban Development and industry (3-10yrs)
  • Experience primarily using 12D, AutoCAD, desirably PC-Drain
  • Knowledge of Australian design standards and applicable legislation
  • Ability to structure time and manage workload across internal divisions
  • Ability to communicate at all levels including client liaison

In return for your experience, you will receive:

  • Culture that thrives on passion, innovation and career development
  • Competitive remuneration package
  • Proactive mentor environment with a career development path (industry leading program)
  • A strong order book of work ensuring long-term retention
  • Integral member of a high performance team

If you are passionate about civil design, aspiring to make a difference and want to be an integral part of a leading corporate consultancy, I urge you to apply by hitting the link below.

Please note that experience in the Australian consulting environment is essential!

Alternatively, for a confidential appraisal of the current market please contact or email your resume quoting reference number TC28311

Consultant: Trent Clulow
Phone: (07) 3009 9626
Email: trent@stellarrecruitment.com.au

JobListing.ShortDescription: experienced and qualified contracts administrator

Bulletpoints.BulletPoint1: Diverse Commercial Building Projects for projects over $30Mil
Bulletpoints.BulletPoint2: Respected Brisbane based Builder, Proud History of Success
Bulletpoints.BulletPoint3: Exciting Career Prospects, Great salary + super

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Our client is a highly successful Brisbane based building company that has had a great opportunity come available for a career driven Contract Administrator to join their fast paced Brisbane team. This builder has strong local presence, a young vibrant culture, and a terrific history of successfully completing a broad range of commercial building projects around the $30Million plus range.


As Contract Administrator within this business you will work within a successful and vibrant team environment and undertake commercial and cost management duties for projects of various nature in the commercial building space. As a guide your projects will likely include schools, aged care, health care, defence, industrial, office buildings and mixed use developments. This company prides itself on hiring people to develop a long term career rather than gathering a new team per project.


You will be a “self-sufficient” Contract Administrator with a thorough understanding of pre and post award contracts administration tasks, coupled with great attention to detail. Within your role you will review tender documentation, prepare subcontractor documents, manage subcontractor packages and payments, variations and progress claims, prepare financial cost forecasts, monitor cash flow, budgeting, and prepare progress reports.


Ideally you will have the following qualifications and background as the successful applicant:

  • Tertiary qualifications in Quantity Surveying or Construction Management & Economics
  • 3-5 years stable experience as a Contract Administrator for commercial builders
  • Proficient using construction specific software
  • Great interpersonal skills, team oriented approach and good work ethic
  • Currently based in Brisbane with existing rights to live and work in Australia

An appealing remuneration package + super will be offered to attract the ideal Contract Administrator. If you are seeking an exciting career move get in touch today!

To apply for this position please click on the APPLY link below. Alternatively, for a confidential appraisal of the current market please contact or email your resume quoting reference number KS28319.

Consultant: Kate Szczurowski

Phone: 07 3009 9630

Email: kate.s@stellarrecruitment.com.au

JobListing.ShortDescription: Exciting opportunity to work for a local contractor who are one of the top performers in the market with a pipeline of work that speaks for itself
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Relocate to Christchurch, New Zealand

  • Christchurch based long term position
  • Senior position and responsibilities
  • Professional team that works together



If you are a Senior Quantity Surveyor looking for an opportunity to work with colleagues that are respected, knowledgeable and professional in their areas of specialism within the construction sector, and to have the opportunity to work with a company with a clear vision and head office based in Christchurch, then this is a position that you need to be aware of.

This is an autonomous role, with support and guidance from Senior Management when desired, where you will be responsible for your own portfolio of work in multimillion dollar commercial construction and public sector. You will have an opportunity to build and select your own team of Quantity Surveyors reporting into you, while you assist in the big picture winning and signing contracts on top of a very healthy pipeline of works already won and ready for you to take over.

Software, systems, and tools are already in place that you require to do your job successfully. You will work alongside a professional and experienced Project Manager becoming part of a close knit, non-corporate yet very qualified team, with a family feel.

Your responsibilities will include:

  • Senior Liaison with all related design consultants and construction sub-contractors
  • Detailed pricing and scheduling of quantities
  • Evaluation, selection and negotiation of sub-contract tenders
  • Cost/budget management
  • Leadership and work allocation to Quantity Surveyor’s
  • Estimation


To be considered for this position you will have:

  • A relevant qualification
  • Must be based in Christchurch, nearby or thinking of relocation
  • 10 years + experience in Quantity Surveying
  • Working on projects $20M +

This is a genuine are rare opportunity due to growth. We are seeking long term skilled applicants with a passion for their field of work and commitment to Canterbury.

Please contact James today on 03 353 5688 to learn more about this company and position, or express your interest by clicking on the APPLY link below. Your application will be treated in the strictest confidence.

Consultant: James Gillanders
Phone: 03 353 5688
Email: james.g@stellarrecruitment.co.nz

JobListing.ShortDescription: Exciting opportunity to work for a local contractor who are one of the top performers in the market with a pipeline of work that speaks for itself
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Relocate to Christchurch, New Zealand

  • Christchurch based long term position
  • Senior position and responsibilities
  • Professional team that works together



If you are a Senior Quantity Surveyor looking for an opportunity to work with colleagues that are respected, knowledgeable and professional in their areas of specialism within the construction sector, and to have the opportunity to work with a company with a clear vision and head office based in Christchurch, then this is a position that you need to be aware of.

This is an autonomous role, with support and guidance from Senior Management when desired, where you will be responsible for your own portfolio of work in multimillion dollar commercial construction and public sector. You will have an opportunity to build and select your own team of Quantity Surveyors reporting into you, while you assist in the big picture winning and signing contracts on top of a very healthy pipeline of works already won and ready for you to take over.

Software, systems, and tools are already in place that you require to do your job successfully. You will work alongside a professional and experienced Project Manager becoming part of a close knit, non-corporate yet very qualified team, with a family feel.

Your responsibilities will include:

  • Senior Liaison with all related design consultants and construction sub-contractors
  • Detailed pricing and scheduling of quantities
  • Evaluation, selection and negotiation of sub-contract tenders
  • Cost/budget management
  • Leadership and work allocation to Quantity Surveyor’s
  • Estimation


To be considered for this position you will have:

  • A relevant qualification

JobListing.ShortDescription: Seeking experienced excavator operators for an even time roster, minimum 6 month contract. Coal mine located near Blackwater.
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• BIBO Even time 5/5 roster
  • Immediate Start
  • Mine located near Blackwater
  • Camps and meals provided

The team at Stellar Workforce would like to hear from experienced coal mining  Excavator Operators who hold RII’s for the following machinery:

  • Liebherr 994 and 996

To be considered for this role you must display a strong and stable work background with 3+ years recent mining experience, in addition to a safety first attitude. Ideal applicants will be available to commence immediately.

Successful applicants must be able to supply:

  • Current CBM – Section 4
  • Standard 11
  • Current Drivers Licence
  • Supporting RIIs

Please note these are not trainee positions and candidates will only be contacted if they meet the above criteria.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Take the next step in your career with a compnay renowned for producing Award-Winning work! Call Jolene Marks (09) 9691023
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Established Company

  • Career Advancement

  • Excellent team environment

Stellar Recruitment has partnered with a prestigious Architecture firm to source a talented Intermediate Architect who is competent in Revit. In this role, you will play an integral part of a team who are working on a range of mid - large scale commerical projects. Renowned for their Award-Winning Architecture,  you will enjoy being part of a high performing culture with opportunity for progression and career advancement.

To be successful in this role you must have the following attributes:

  • 4+ years’ post grad experience

  • Proficient with Revit

  • Current up to date knowledge of the NZ build code

  • Ability to work independently and within a team

  • Experience in mid-large scale projects

In return for your experience and expertise, you will receive:

  • An industry leading company

  • Culture that thrives on passion, innovation and career development

  • Competitive remuneration package with additional benefits

  • A genuine career path

  • The opportunity to Build long term relationships within the sector

So if you are passionate about advancing your career, aspiring to make a difference and want to be an integral part of a leading Architecture firm, I urge you to apply by hitting the link below.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Christchurch workshop based role
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Are you an experienced welder / fabricator?
• Do you have experience with truck and bus or mobile plant repairs?
• Are you flexible and able to start immediately?
• Do you have you welding tickets?

If you can say yes to all of the points above, our clients are looking for experienced welders/fitters/fabricators for their Christchurch workshop. In this role you will be hands on welding/repairing a range of truck and trailer, or mobile equipment such as excavators, dozers, loaders rollers and other plant equipment. You will also have the opportunity to continue to develop your technical skills and experience, and will be rewarded with an extremely competitive hourly rate above market standard. In these positions you will be hard working and prepared to put in the hard yards when required of you. You will be committed to safe work practices and be passionate about your industry.

To be successful in this role you will have:
• Proven experience in a similar role within the heavy transport or mobile equipment industry
• Appropriate welding licences and/or an ability to renew these
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
• Reliable and hard working with a “can do” attitude
• Be flexible with hours and available immediately
• Experience with alloy welding and/or auto CAD would be very advantageous

To apply, or if you’d like to know more, such as location info, pay rates, work conditions and facilities, the gear you’ll be working on, or for info on other opportunities that we have throughout New Zealand, contact our specialist maintenance recruiter today.


Charlotte Heystek
03 353 5687
charlotte.h@stellarworkforce.co.nz

JobListing.ShortDescription: Process Worker/Machine Operator required for an immediate start - Night/Afternoon Shift - 4 Day Week! $25 - $28 p/h
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Our client is currently seeking a hard working individual with a background in machine operation and/or process work for their south of the river manufacturing plant. The position will be for either afternoon or night shift, however all training will be done initially during the days until fully trained.

Responsibilities / Skills:

- Packing and storing of plastic boxes

- Background or knowledge of injection mould or extrusion machines (preferred)

- Troubleshooting and general maintenance for machine breakdowns

- Forklift operation

- Boiler Attendant Ticket (preferred)

- Operation and supervision of process machines

- Loading and unloading trucks

- Available for shift work

This role represents a fantastic career opportunity with a clear and direct path into a Supervisor/Team Leader role.

Email your application today!!

JobListing.ShortDescription: Customer Support Representative - Gunnedah - Long Term Opportunity
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• World Leading OEM Dealership
  • Diverse Role with High Performance Culture
  • Long Term Secure Position

Gunnedah based Customer Support Representative required for this world leading OEM. Do you have an earthmoving/automotive dealership background with strong customer service sales?

Our client is a major OEM dealership to the mining & construction industries worldwide. Due to further growth and continued sales within Australia, there is a current requirement for a competent Customer Support Sales Representative to service the Gunnedah branch, NSW.

Successful candidates will be required to have the following experience:

  • Previous experience working for a major OEM either Earthmoving or Automotive
  • A mechanical aptitude or parts interpreting background (highly desirable)
  • Strong communication and face to face customer service experience
  • Computer Literate
  • Forklift License (Desirable)

The key responsibilities within this role will be:

  • To maximise business turnover and provide strong customer service to our client's diverse range of clients.
  • Coordinate parts sales and offer customer support whilst liaising with the clients to enhance close working relationships.
  • Meet company KPI’s to help increase company machine sales, and various other after sales offerings.
  • Support the company profile to work in an environment that promotes continuous improvement.

This impressive organisation boasts a strong company culture that provides an enjoyable and supportive environment to progress your career. You will also be supported by an experienced team allowing you to develop your technical skills within an expanding OEM group!

To apply for this position please click on the APPLY link below.
Alternatively, for a confidential appraisal of the current market please contact or email your resume quoting reference number LE28391

Consultant: Lucas Eyers
Email: lucas@stellarrecruitment.com.au

JobListing.ShortDescription: Calling all Plumbers - Christchurch Region
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Calling all Plumbers!

Right now we are actively seeking Trade Qualified Plumbers, who are confident in all aspects of plumbing, to take on a variety of major commercial and domestic projects within the general vicinity of Christchurch.

Scope of work includes; Commercial Maintenance, New installs, Renovations, Upgrades maintenance from new housing, to light commercial work.

All applicants for this role will need;

  • At least 5 years industry experience
  • A minimum of 2 years’ experience in NZ
  • Trade Qualification (either in NZ or overseas) – to be a certifying plumber would be advantageous
  • To be currently registered/licensed with the Plumbers, Drainlayers and Gasfitters Board of NZ.
  • Have a solid understanding of the current New Zealand Plumbing Regulations, health and safety (HSE/OSH).
  • A clean full drivers licence (minimum of class 1,),
  • Your own reliable transport
  • Christchurch based, or be willing to relocate
  • To have a high standard or workmanship,
  • To be reliable and able to work unsupervised and
  • At least two referees that attest to your honesty, work ethic and drive.
     

Working as part of team is also important due to the critical timeframes involved in these projects.

Ideally you will be able to provide your own hand and power tools and a site safe card would benefit your application.

Stellar are looking for ambitious, capable and energetic people with a good dose of common sense to join our team. We work hard to be the best, we give it our all and we take pride in what we do. We know we're only as good as our people, and we've been successfully growing over the past 7 years, partnering with skilled tradesmen and large organisations, because of it.

We offer the opportunity for career progression, the potential for permanent employment and work in a supportive environment. With Stellar Recruitment, you are more than just a number – we will work with you to ensure that the role you accept is the right fit for you – not just another job.

We are aware that wages don’t work for everyone, so also offer a contracting option with all invoices paid weekly – Whatever works for you!

Applicants should be aware that both our, and our clients Health and Safety Standards are very high and we reserve the right to conduct a drug test pre-employment as well as random alcohol and drug testing throughout employment.

If you would like to apply for this role or for more information please contact Leah at Stellar Workforce on 03 3535681 today.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Trade Certified Carpenter
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Calling all Carpenters!

Right now we are urgently seeking experienced builders for a variety of work.  Whether you are a trade qualified carpenter or have put the time in on the tools we have work for you.

Work includes;

  • Small to large commercial projects
  • Residential new builds
  • Joinery and Cabinetry

All applicants for these roles will need;

  • At least 4 years industry experience in the area you would like to work in
  • A clean full drivers licence (minimum of class 1),
  • Your own reliable transport in order to get yourself to and from site
  • To be confident reading & working from construction plans & drawings

Ideally you will be able to provide your own hand and power tools and a site safe card would benefit your application.

JobListing.JobTitle: Intermediate - Senior Civil Engineer land and site
JobListing.ShortDescription: Intermediate to Senior Civil Engineer for Emerging Consultancy with focus on sub divisions
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
3 months into 2016 Civil Engineers stick or twist?
Somehow we have blinked and we are now 3 months into 2016, the year has started quickly and in all accounts is looking to be exciting, busy and very prosperous, or is it? Incidentally what is the view like in your office? If you’re reading this at work I can only assume it’s pretty bleak.
Stellar have been busy forging and strengthening relationships and really delving and uncovering the goals or our clients and are very happy to be supporting this emerging client in growing on its existing high performance and healthy work life balance.
With Long established rock solid reputation and growing success built around its existing team, growth is now the word and this company is looking to bring the right staff in to the fold. With openings for intermediate to Senior Engineers, career plans are waiting for the right candidate who feels they want to pursue and develop their career further in to the management field. Every avenue is covered from soft skill training to freedom to express yourself. If you have an eye on the future there can only be one course of action, get in touch today.

What you will need
• 5+years design experience
• New Zealand Experience
• Strong Sub division experience
• Ability to liaise with clients
• Ambition to grow and develop

What this company will give you
• Great company culture
• Guided career path
• Annual Bonus
• Flexible structured hours
*********************************************************************
I must implore you that New Zealand experience is essential and I cannot consider anyone without recent New Zealand experience.
**********************************************************************
So if you’re tired of flicking through social media every 10 minutes, watching the kettle boil is not making the day run any faster, then I think it is really time to venture out further. At stellar we really believe in partnership and strong relationships and that only comes from listening, and finding out what you want. The best way to see your dreams come true is to voice them, if you match the above criteria then please email adam.t@stellarrecruitment.co.nz or call 09 9691029 and lets change the years forecast together. Your cards may have been dealt but that doesn’t mean this will be your hand for life, the dealer is now looking at you, It’s your turn what will it be? Stick or twist?
 

Adam Towler
Engineering & Design Specialist
P +64 9 969 1029
E- adam.t@stellarrecruitment.co.nz
SK917023A
